venue.name: The Tap at the Haverhill Brewery

item.description:
The membership has voted. For our first brewpub of the month we are going to the TAP in Haverhill, Ma.

About the Brewpub:
The TAP has been a restaurant and bar since 1897 and a brewpub since 2003. If you're looking for fresh-made beer and a nice variety of brews to choose from, The Tap is the place to go. Not every New England town has their own brewpub, but Haverhill does! The custom made beers are made on the premises and the food is standard fare for a place like this which emphasizes drink over all. There's something for everyone on the menu, reasonable prices, and plenty of dining room space so you can bring the whole family.

http://www.grohol.com...

The Beers:
http://www.tapbrewpub...

The Menu:
http://www.tapbrewpub...

Live Music:
http://www.tapbrewpub...

Directions:

DRIVING: Take exit 49 (Rte 110 east/River Street) off Route 495 north. Follow through two sets of lights. This road turns into Washington St. To park your automobile, take a right just after you pass under the RR bridge, at the blue "P" sign, into the city parking lot located just behind the building. Approximately 40 minutes driving time from Boston.
TRAIN: The Tap is accessible by Commuter Rail from North Station; Take the Haverhill/Reading line - tickets are $5.50 one way - we are located just across the road from the Haverhill Commuter Rail station.
You may contact the MBTA at 617-222-3200 or 1-800-392-6100

http://www.tapbrewpub...
item.how_to_find_us: I will have a meetup sign.
